articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Police in Georgia fired water cannon and tear gas to disperse protesters in Tbilisi, the capital, who opposed the government's decision to suspend talks on joining the European Union, while some were detained, Russian agencies said on Monday.
articles.title: Georgia police fire tear gas to scatter protesters, Russian agencies say

articles.author: Suleiman Al-Khalidi
articles.description: At least 25 people were killed in northwestern Syria in air strikes carried out by the Syrian government and Russia, the Syrian opposition-run rescue service known as the White Helmets said early on Monday.
articles.title: At least 25 killed as Russian, Syrian jets intensify bombing of Syrian rebel territory

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Israeli forces kept up bombardments across the enclave and blew up houses on its northern edge.
articles.title: Israeli strikes kill 15 in Gaza, Cairo holds fresh talks with Hamas

articles.author: Luiza Ilie
articles.description: Romania's ruling leftist Social Democrats (PSD) looked set to win the most votes in a parliamentary election on Sunday, defeating a resurgent far-right movement challenging the country's pro-Western orientation, an exit poll showed.
articles.title: Romanian leftists ahead of resurgent far-right in election: exit poll

articles.author: Jeff Mason
articles.description: The White House had said repeatedly that Biden would not pardon or commute the sentences of his son, a recovering drug addict who became a target of Republicans, including Donald Trump.
articles.title: Biden says he is pardoning his son, Hunter

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russia's drone attack on Ukraine's western city of Ternopil hit a residential building, killing one person and injuring several others, Ternopil's military administration said on Monday.
articles.title: Russia's drone attack on Ternopil kills one, Ukraine's military says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: President Ferdinand Marcos Jr. said on Monday the reported presence of a Russian submarine in the Philippine's exclusive economic zone (EEZ) in the South China Sea was "very worrisome".
articles.title: Philippines' Marcos says reported presence of Russian submarine 'very worrisome'

articles.author: David Ljunggren
articles.description: Trump has promised to slap tariffs on Canadian imports unless Ottawa prevents migrants and drugs from crossing the frontier. Canada sends 75% of all goods and services exports to the United States.
articles.title: Trudeau promised Trump tougher border controls, says top Canada official

articles.author: Jessica Donati, Trevor Hunnicutt
articles.description: His trip delivers on one of a big set of pledges to Africa. Others remain unrealized, such as backing two permanent seats for Africa at the U.N. Security Council.
articles.title: Biden's long-awaited Africa trip to tout a win against China

articles.author: Stephanie Van Den Berg
articles.description: The United Nations' top court on Monday starts hearings on the legal obligation of countries to fight climate change and the consequences for states of contributing to global warming, the outcome of which could influence litigation worldwide.
articles.title: World Court to open climate change hearings
